oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |a!kunta (Stoffel) (I)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The old woman sings about the Hyena who carried her off, and how she sprang aside when he tried to throw her onto a pointed rock, so that he instead fell onto the pointed rock and was killed. 1) See also The old woman and the hyena and Old woman's song (2nd version), 2) This story is found in Book I- 2.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The old woman's song
